instruction: Find at least three representative survey papers on LLM agents on Google Scholar, and add their titles to the Notes.
future_tasks: Find three detailed user reviews of the Bose QC45 headphones from Amazon. Summarize the general sentiment in the Notes.

I have some onions, beef, and potatoes in my refrigerator. Can you find me a Chinese-style recipe that uses all three ingredients and can be prepared in under an hour? And find me a video tutorial on YouTube for that. Stop at the screen displaying the video.

Can you check the MacDonald's APP to see if there are any Rewards or Deals including Spicy McCrispy. If so, help me add that to Mobile Order (Do not pay yet, I will do it myself). And then check the pickup location and get directions on Google Maps. Stop at the screen showing the route.

raw_response:
### Thought ###
To find three representative survey papers on LLM (Large Language Model) agents, I will use Google Scholar. The process involves opening the Google Scholar website, searching for relevant survey papers, and noting down their titles. Once I have the titles, I will add them to the Notes app. 

### Plan ###
1. Open the Chrome browser.
2. Navigate to Google Scholar by searching for "Google Scholar" or directly entering the URL.
3. Search for "survey papers on LLM agents."
4. Identify at least three representative survey papers and note their titles.
5. Open the Notes app and add the titles to a new note.

### Current Subgoal ###
Open the Chrome browser.
